Subjects: Thomas of Canterbury, saint, prayers to; prayers, to saints
_description: A prayer to St Thomas of Canterbury, attributed to Lydgate — two 8-line stanzas

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Blyssed Thomas rubyfyed with bloodfor Ihesus sake stable in thyn
                    Entent…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…ffor Ihesus sake wich is most parfit goodfor whom at
                    Caunterbury shad was thy holy blood
BodLauMis683.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 139.
